section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Mortgage loan" includes a loan to:
finance or refinance the purchase of stock or membership in a cooperative ownership housing corporation; or
rehabilitate units in a cooperative ownership housing corporation.
"Reverse equity mortgage loan" includes a loan that uses the equity in a home as collateral.

In accordance with § 4-213 of this subtitle, the Administration may make, participate in making, purchase, and undertake a commitment for:
a mortgage loan or other financial assistance secured by a mortgage lien for a community development project or public purpose project; and
a reverse equity mortgage loan secured by a mortgage lien that is for housing related expenses of an elderly household that qualifies as a family of limited income.

Financial assistance to purchase a dwelling unit in a community development project or public purpose project under paragraph (1)(i) of this subsection may include a temporary loan or advance and a permanent direct mortgage loan to a family of limited income, if otherwise required by law.
Housing related expenses under paragraph (1)(ii) of this subsection include personal expenses that enable the owner to continue to occupy the owner's home.
A commitment, mortgage, bond, or secured note shall contain terms and conditions necessary to secure repayment of its loan, the interest on it, and other charges in connection with the loan.

Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, a mortgage loan for a community development project or a public purpose project and a reverse equity mortgage loan may bear interest at a rate or rates that the Administration finds will make the project economically feasible.

The Administration may not increase the interest rate originally charged on a permanent direct mortgage loan to a family for the purchase of a dwelling unit in a community development project or a public purpose project.

Subject to any agreement with noteholders or bondholders, the Administration may consent to the modification of the interest rate, time of payment of any installment of principal or interest, security, or any other term, of a mortgage, mortgage loan, reverse equity mortgage loan, mortgage loan commitment, or reverse equity mortgage loan commitment, contract, or agreement to which the Administration is a party.

text.section:
In connection with property on which it holds a mortgage loan or reverse equity mortgage loan:
the Administration may:
foreclose on the property or begin an action to protect or enforce a right that is conferred on the Administration by law, a mortgage contract, or other agreement;
bid for and purchase the property at a foreclosure or other sale; or
acquire or take possession of the property; and
in a manner to protect the interests of the Administration, the Administration may:
complete, administer, and pay the principal of and interest on an obligation incurred in connection with the property;
dispose of the property; and
otherwise deal with the property.

section.section: This subsection does not apply to a lien held in connection with a public purpose project.

The Administration may not lend money on the security of property unless the lien on the property is superior to all other liens, except for:
liens for taxes owed to the State or a political subdivision; or
earlier mortgage liens.

text.section:
The Administration may:
sell any mortgage or other obligation that it holds, at public or private sale, with or without public bidding; and
retain the servicing rights and charge servicing fees for any mortgage or other obligation the Administration sells.

The Administration may purchase securities backed by mortgages to provide financial assistance to community development projects and public purpose projects and to finance residential mortgage loans with the proceeds of the securities or with investment earnings on the securities.
